  • Method Details

    • importXmlData

      public ImportResults importXmlData(String xmlData) throws RequiredFieldException
      Description copied from interface: IImportTools
      Import XML data. See the file APPNAME_import.xsd, where APPNAME is cc, pc or bc, for details of the expected XML format. To improve performance, the XML data string can be wrapped with CDATA tags. For example: 
      <![CDATA[
      
   ...import XML...
      
 ]]>
      Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

      WARNING: this is only supported for certain tables: (1) administrative database tables, such as User; (2) new customer-defined entities that are simple reference tables (look up tables). Because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data, any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported.

      Specified by:
      importXmlData in interface IImportTools
      Parameters:
      xmlData - The data to import, passed as a String.
      Returns:
      Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.
      Throws:
      RequiredFieldException

    • importExternalConfigXmlData

      public ImportResults importExternalConfigXmlData(String xmlData) throws RequiredFieldException
      Processes feed from external configuration manager. Such XML might contain extensions specific for externalized configuration management and behaves differently than plain
      invalid @link 
      {@link ImportToolsImpl::importXmlData
      }.
      Parameters:
      xmlData -
      Returns:
      Throws:
      RequiredFieldException

      Throws:
      RequiredFieldException

    • importXmlDataAsByteArray

      public ImportResults importXmlDataAsByteArray(byte[] xmlData) throws DataConversionException, SOAPException, PermissionException
      Description copied from interface: IImportTools
      Import XML data, passing the data as an array of UTF-8 bytes representing the XML string. See the file APPNAME_import.xsd, where APPNAME is cc, pc or bc, for details of the expected XML format. To improve performance, the XML data string can be wrapped with CDATA tags. For example: 
      <![CDATA[
      
   ...import XML...
      
 ]]>
      Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

      WARNING: this is only supported for certain tables: (1) administrative database tables, such as User; (2) new customer-defined entities that are simple reference tables (look up tables). Because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data, any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported.

      Specified by:
      importXmlDataAsByteArray in interface IImportTools
      Parameters:
      xmlData - The data to import, passed as a byte[] for the UTF-8 bytes representing the XML string.
      Returns:
      Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.
      Throws:
      DataConversionException - If the data can't be imported because it violates duplicate key constraints, contains nulls in non-nullable fields, or otherwise can't be safely inserted into the database.
      SOAPException
      PermissionException
      See Also:
      • IImportTools.importXmlData(String)

    • importCsvData

      public ImportResults importCsvData(String csvData, int dataSet, boolean ignoreNullConstraintViolations, boolean ignoreAllErrors) throws DataConversionException, SOAPException, PermissionException
      Description copied from interface: IImportTools
      Import XML data. See the file APPNAME_import.xsd, where APPNAME is cc, pc or bc, for details of the expected XML format. To improve performance, the XML data string can be wrapped with CDATA tags. For example: 
      <![CDATA[
      
   ...import XML...
      
 ]]>
      Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

      WARNING: this is only supported for certain tables: (1) administrative database tables, such as User; (2) new customer-defined entities that are simple reference tables (look up tables). Because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data, any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported.

      Specified by:
      importCsvData in interface IImportTools
      Parameters:
      csvData - The data to import, passed as a String.
      Returns:
      Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.
      Throws:
      DataConversionException - If the data can't be imported because it violates duplicate key constraints, contains nulls in non-nullable fields, or otherwise can't be safely inserted into the database.
      SOAPException
      PermissionException

    • csvToXml

      public String csvToXml(String csvData, boolean ignoreNullViolations, boolean ignoreAllErrors) throws SOAPServerException, RequiredFieldException
      Description copied from interface: IImportTools
      Convert CSV data to XML data suitable to be imported by IImportTools.importXmlData(String)
      Specified by:
      csvToXml in interface IImportTools
      Parameters:
      csvData - A String containing CSV data
      ignoreNullViolations - Whether to continue after detecting an empty field in the CSV that corresponds to a property that is not nullable. If false, throws an exception in this situation.
      ignoreAllErrors -
      Returns:
      a String containing equivalent import data in XML format, suitable for import by #importXmlData(String)
      Throws:
      SOAPServerException
      RequiredFieldException

    • csvToXml

      public String csvToXml(String csvData, int dataSet, boolean ignoreNullViolations, boolean ignoreAllErrors) throws SOAPServerException
      Description copied from interface: IImportTools
      Convert CSV data to XML data suitable to be imported IImportTools.importXmlData(String)
      Specified by:
      csvToXml in interface IImportTools
      Parameters:
      csvData - A String containing CSV data
      dataSet - An int defining the number of the dataset to be imported. Datasets are ordered by inclusion, and the smallest dataset is always numbered 0. Thus Dataset 0 is a subset of dataset 1, and datatset 1 is a subset of dataset 2, etc. If this param is set to -1, all data will be imported.
      ignoreNullViolations - Whether to continue after detecting an empty field in the CSV that corresponds to a property that is not nullable. If false, throws an exception in this situation.
      ignoreAllErrors -
      Returns:
      a String containing equivalent import data in XML format, suitable for import by #importXmlData(String)
      Throws:
      SOAPServerException

    • xmlToCsv

      public String xmlToCsv(String xmlData)
      Description copied from interface: IImportTools
      Export XML data into CSV data. The reverse operation from #csvToXml(String)
      Specified by:
      xmlToCsv in interface IImportTools
      Parameters:
      xmlData - String containing CSV data
      Returns:
      a String containing equivalent import data in CSV format. The result of calling csvToXml on the result should be an equivalent XML document to #xmlData.

    • rebuildRolePrivileges

      public void rebuildRolePrivileges() throws SOAPServerException
      Description copied from interface: IImportTools
      Rebuild the role privileges data by deleting the priviliges data in the database, and then re-importing the roleprivileges.csv file.
      Specified by:
      rebuildRolePrivileges in interface IImportTools
      Throws:
      SOAPServerException

    • isRunPreUpdateRulesOnImport

      protected boolean isRunPreUpdateRulesOnImport()

    • commitImportedBundle

      public ImportResults commitImportedBundle(Bundle bundle, String[] errorLog, long startTime)
      This will commit the bundle and create an import result. If had critical errors, the errorLog would be null. This is meant to be called from importXMLBlobAndCommit, it is exposed as a simplification for use in some perf actions. Its use outside of that method is not really supported.. This method is public only to be used in CC/cc-perf RegionGenerator.java . Use `importXmlData` or similar methods to import data.
      Parameters:
      bundle - the bundle to commit
      errorLog -
      startTime -
      Returns:
